dt: {bc}to bring forth stillborn, nonviable, or premature offspring
{bc}to become checked in development so as to degenerate or remain rudimentary

dt.t: the pilot decided to {wi}abort{/wi} due to mechanical difficulties

dt: {bc}to induce the {a_link|abortion} of or give birth to prematurely
{bc}to terminate the pregnancy of before term

et: in part borrowed from Latin {it}abortus{/it}, past participle of {it}aborīrī{/it} "to pass away, be lost, (of a fetus) miscarry, be aborted, (of a woman) miscarry," from {it}ab-{/it} {et_link|ab-|ab-} + {it}orīrī{/it} "to rise, come into existence, be born"; in part borrowed from Late Latin {it}abortīre{/it} and {it}abortīrī{/it} "(of a woman) to miscarry," derivatives of Latin {it}aborīrī{/it} {ma}{mat|orient:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: to bring forth stillborn, nonviable, or premature offspring
to become checked in development so as to degenerate or remain rudimentary
